page.title: 04The Five Bells Inn
page.content:
The Five Bells is an inn just out of Wrentham. It was made in 1611 which makes it 389 years old. It has 7 rooms, a kitchen, two bars, a storeroom, a cellar and, behind the bar, well, that's not really a room. In the summer it gets good trade. It has two stables, one for horses and one for chickens. Around the back there is a caravan park. Nick Tanner
Dad opens at 12 o'clock and he shuts at 3 o'clock. Then he comes and picks Nick (who wrote the first part of this page) and me up from school. Then he has a rest. Then at 7 o'clock Dad goes down and opens the pub up. Then at 11 o'clock at night we close. We have a treat when the clock chimes. The lights light up. Sarah Tanner
